org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream

Class DataStream<OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.flink.streaming.api.datastream.DataStream<OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    OUT - The type of the DataStream, i.e., the type of the elements of the DataStream.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GroupedDataStream, SingleOutputStreamOperator

    public class DataStream<OUT>
extends Object
    A DataStream represents a stream of elements of the same type. A DataStream can be transformed into another DataStream by applying a transformation as for example
    • map(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.MapFunction<OUT, R>),
    • filter(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FilterFunction<OUT>), or
    • aggregate(org.apache.flink.streaming.api.function.aggregation.AggregationFunction<OUT>).

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DataStream.ConnectionType
      Partitioning strategy on the stream.

      Applies an aggregation that that gives the current element with the maximum value at the given position, if more elements have the maximum value at the given position, the operator returns the first one by default.

      Applies an aggregation that that gives the current element with the maximum value at the given position, if more elements have the maximum value at the given position, the operator returns either the first or last one, depending on the parameter set.

      Writes a DataStream to the standard output stream (stdout).
      StreamProjection<OUT> project(int... fieldIndexes)
      Initiates a Project transformation on a Tuple DataStream.
      Note: Only Tuple DataStreams can be projected.
      The transformation projects each Tuple of the DataSet onto a (sub)set of fields.
      This method returns a StreamProjection on which StreamProjection.types(Class) needs to be called to completed the transformation.
      SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> reduce(ReduceFunction<OUT> reducer)
      Applies a reduce transformation on the data stream.

      • merge

        public DataStream<OUT> merge(DataStream<OUT>... streams)
        Creates a new DataStream by merging DataStream outputs of the same type with each other. The DataStreams merged using this operator will be transformed simultaneously.
        Parameters:
        streams - The DataStreams to merge output with.
        Returns:
        The DataStream.

      • connect

        public <R> ConnectedDataStream<OUT,R> connect(DataStream<R> dataStream)
        Creates a new ConnectedDataStream by connecting DataStream outputs of different type with each other. The DataStreams connected using this operators can be used with CoFunctions.
        Parameters:
        dataStream - The DataStream with which this stream will be joined.
        Returns:
        The ConnectedDataStream.

      • partitionBy

        public DataStream<OUT> partitionBy(int keyPosition)
        Sets the partitioning of the DataStream so that the output tuples are partitioned by their hashcode and are sent to only one component.
        Parameters:
        keyPosition - The field used to compute the hashcode.
        Returns:
        The DataStream with field partitioning set.

      • broadcast

        public DataStream<OUT> broadcast()
        Sets the partitioning of the DataStream so that the output tuples are broadcasted to every parallel instance of the next component.
        Returns:
        The DataStream with broadcast partitioning set.

      • shuffle

        public DataStream<OUT> shuffle()
        Sets the partitioning of the DataStream so that the output tuples are shuffled to the next component.
        Returns:
        The DataStream with shuffle partitioning set.

      • forward

        public DataStream<OUT> forward()
        Sets the partitioning of the DataStream so that the output tuples are forwarded to the local subtask of the next component. This is the default partitioner setting.
        Returns:
        The DataStream with shuffle partitioning set.

      • distribute

        public DataStream<OUT> distribute()
        Sets the partitioning of the DataStream so that the output tuples are distributed evenly to the next component.
        Returns:
        The DataStream with shuffle partitioning set.

      • map

        public <R> SingleOutputStreamOperator<R,?> map(MapFunction<OUT,R> mapper)
        Applies a Map transformation on a DataStream. The transformation calls a MapFunction for each element of the DataStream. Each MapFunction call returns exactly one element. The user can also extend RichMapFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFunction interface.
        Type Parameters:
        R - output type
        Parameters:
        mapper - The MapFunction that is called for each element of the DataStream.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • flatMap

        public <R> SingleOutputStreamOperator<R,?> flatMap(FlatMapFunction<OUT,R> flatMapper)
        Applies a FlatMap transformation on a DataStream. The transformation calls a FlatMapFunction for each element of the DataStream. Each FlatMapFunction call can return any number of elements including none. The user can also extend RichFlatMapFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFunction interface.
        Type Parameters:
        R - output type
        Parameters:
        flatMapper - The FlatMapFunction that is called for each element of the DataStream
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • reduce

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> reduce(ReduceFunction<OUT> reducer)
        Applies a reduce transformation on the data stream. The user can also extend the RichReduceFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFunction interface.
        Parameters:
        reducer - The ReduceFunction that will be called for every element of the input values.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • project

        public StreamProjection<OUT> project(int... fieldIndexes)
        Initiates a Project transformation on a Tuple DataStream.
        Note: Only Tuple DataStreams can be projected.
        The transformation projects each Tuple of the DataSet onto a (sub)set of fields.
        This method returns a StreamProjection on which StreamProjection.types(Class) needs to be called to completed the transformation.
        Parameters:
        fieldIndexes - The field indexes of the input tuples that are retained. The order of fields in the output tuple corresponds to the order of field indexes.
        Returns:
        A StreamProjection that needs to be converted into a DataStream to complete the project transformation by calling StreamProjection.types(Class).
        See Also:
        Tuple, DataStream

      • groupBy

        public GroupedDataStream<OUT> groupBy(int keyPosition)
        Groups the elements of a DataStream by the given key position to be used with grouped operators like GroupedDataStream.reduce(ReduceFunction)
        Parameters:
        keyPosition - The position of the field on which the DataStream will be grouped.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • batch

        public BatchedDataStream<OUT> batch(long batchSize,
                                    long slideSize)
        Collects the data stream elements into sliding batches creating a new BatchedDataStream. The user can apply transformations like BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>), BatchedDataStream.reduceGroup(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.GroupReduceFunction<OUT, R>) or aggregations on the BatchedDataStream.
        Parameters:
        batchSize - The number of elements in each batch at each operator
        slideSize - The number of elements with which the batches are slid by after each transformation.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • batch

        public BatchedDataStream<OUT> batch(long batchSize)
        Collects the data stream elements into sliding batches creating a new BatchedDataStream. The user can apply transformations like BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>), BatchedDataStream.reduceGroup(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.GroupReduceFunction<OUT, R>) or aggregations on the BatchedDataStream.
        Parameters:
        batchSize - The number of elements in each batch at each operator
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • window

        public WindowDataStream<OUT> window(long windowSize,
                                    long slideInterval,
                                    TimeStamp<OUT> timestamp)
        Collects the data stream elements into sliding windows creating a new WindowDataStream. The user can apply transformations like BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>), BatchedDataStream.reduceGroup(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.GroupReduceFunction<OUT, R>) or aggregations on the WindowDataStream.
        Parameters:
        windowSize - The length of the window in milliseconds.
        slideInterval - The number of milliseconds with which the windows are slid by after each transformation.
        timestamp - User defined function for extracting time-stamps from each element
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • window

        public WindowDataStream<OUT> window(long windowSize,
                                    long slideInterval)
        Collects the data stream elements into sliding windows creating a new WindowDataStream. The user can apply transformations like BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>), BatchedDataStream.reduceGroup(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.GroupReduceFunction<OUT, R>) or aggregations on the WindowDataStream.
        Parameters:
        windowSize - The length of the window in milliseconds.
        slideInterval - The number of milliseconds with which the windows are slid by after each transformation.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

      • window

        public WindowDataStream<OUT> window(long windowSize)
        Collects the data stream elements into sliding windows creating a new WindowDataStream. The user can apply transformations like BatchedDataStream.reduce(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.ReduceFunction<OUT>), BatchedDataStream.reduceGroup(org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.GroupReduceFunction<OUT, R>) or aggregations on the WindowDataStream.
        Parameters:
        windowSize - The length of the window in milliseconds.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream

        Returns:

      • minBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> minBy(int positionToMinBy)
        Applies an aggregation that that gives the current element with the minimum value at the given position, if more elements have the minimum value at the given position, the operator returns the first one by default.
        Parameters:
        positionToMinBy - The position in the data point to minimize
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • minBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> minBy(int positionToMinBy,
                                               boolean first)
        Applies an aggregation that that gives the current element with the minimum value at the given position, if more elements have the minimum value at the given position, the operator returns either the first or last one, depending on the parameter set.
        Parameters:
        positionToMinBy - The position in the data point to minimize
        first - If true, then the operator return the first element with the minimal value, otherwise returns the last
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • min

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> min()
        Syntactic sugar for min(0)
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • maxBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> maxBy(int positionToMaxBy)
        Applies an aggregation that that gives the current element with the maximum value at the given position, if more elements have the maximum value at the given position, the operator returns the first one by default.
        Parameters:
        positionToMaxBy - The position in the data point to maximize
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • maxBy

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> maxBy(int positionToMaxBy,
                                               boolean first)
        Applies an aggregation that that gives the current element with the maximum value at the given position, if more elements have the maximum value at the given position, the operator returns either the first or last one, depending on the parameter set.
        Parameters:
        positionToMaxBy - The position in the data point to maximize.
        first - If true, then the operator return the first element with the maximum value, otherwise returns the last
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

        Applies an aggregation that gives the count of the data point.
        Returns:
        The transformed DataStream.

      • aggregate

        protected SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> aggregate(AggregationFunction<OUT> aggregate)

      • filter

        public SingleOutputStreamOperator<OUT,?> filter(FilterFunction<OUT> filter)
        Applies a Filter transformation on a DataStream. The transformation calls a FilterFunction for each element of the DataStream and retains only those element for which the function returns true. Elements for which the function returns false are filtered. The user can also extend RichFilterFunction to gain access to other features provided by the RichFunction interface.
        Parameters:
        filter - The FilterFunction that is called for each element of the DataSet.
        Returns:
        The filtered DataStream.

      • print

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> print()
        Writes a DataStream to the standard output stream (stdout). For each element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream.

      • writeAsText

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsText(String path)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • writeAsText

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsText(String path,
                                       long millis)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. The writing is performed periodically, in every millis milliseconds. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        millis - is the file update frequency
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • writeAsText

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsText(String path,
                                       int batchSize)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. The writing is performed periodically in equally sized batches. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        batchSize - is the size of the batches, i.e. the number of tuples written to the file at a time
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • writeAsText

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsText(String path,
                                       long millis,
                                       OUT endTuple)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. The writing is performed periodically, in every millis milliseconds. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        millis - is the file update frequency
        endTuple - is a special tuple indicating the end of the stream. If an endTuple is caught, the last pending batch of tuples will be immediately appended to the target file regardless of the system time.
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • writeAsText

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsText(String path,
                                       int batchSize,
                                       OUT endTuple)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. The writing is performed periodically in equally sized batches. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        batchSize - is the size of the batches, i.e. the number of tuples written to the file at a time
        endTuple - is a special tuple indicating the end of the stream. If an endTuple is caught, the last pending batch of tuples will be immediately appended to the target file regardless of the batchSize.
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • writeAsCsv

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsCsv(String path)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • writeAsCsv

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> writeAsCsv(String path,
                                      int batchSize,
                                      OUT endTuple)
        Writes a DataStream to the file specified by path in text format. The writing is performed periodically in equally sized batches. For every element of the DataStream the result of Object.toString() is written.
        Parameters:
        path - is the path to the location where the tuples are written
        batchSize - is the size of the batches, i.e. the number of tuples written to the file at a time
        endTuple - is a special tuple indicating the end of the stream. If an endTuple is caught, the last pending batch of tuples will be immediately appended to the target file regardless of the batchSize.
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream

      • iterate

        public IterativeDataStream<OUT> iterate()
        Initiates an iterative part of the program that executes multiple times and feeds back data streams. The iterative part needs to be closed by calling IterativeDataStream.closeWith(DataStream). The transformation of this IterativeDataStream will be the iteration head. The data stream given to the closeWith(DataStream) method is the data stream that will be fed back and used as the input for the iteration head. Unlike in batch processing by default the output of the iteration stream is directed to both to the iteration head and the next component. To direct tuples to the iteration head or the output specifically one can use the split(OutputSelector) on the iteration tail while referencing the iteration head as 'iterate'.

        The iteration edge will be partitioned the same way as the first input of the iteration head.

        By default a DataStream with iteration will never terminate, but the user can use the IterativeDataStream.setMaxWaitTime(long) call to set a max waiting time for the iteration.

        Returns:
        The iterative data stream created.

      • addIterationSource

        protected <R> DataStream<OUT> addIterationSource(String iterationID,
                                                 long waitTime)

      • addFunction

        protected <R> SingleOutputStreamOperator<R,?> addFunction(String functionName,
                                                          Function function,
                                                          TypeWrapper<OUT> inTypeWrapper,
                                                          TypeWrapper<R> outTypeWrapper,
                                                          StreamInvokable<OUT,R> functionInvokable)
        Internal function for passing the user defined functions to the JobGraph of the job.
        Type Parameters:
        R - type of the return stream
        Parameters:
        functionName - name of the function
        function - the user defined function
        functionInvokable - the wrapping JobVertex instance
        Returns:
        the data stream constructed

      • setConnectionType

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • connectGraph

        protected <X> void connectGraph(DataStream<X> inputStream,
                                String outputID,
                                int typeNumber)
        Internal function for assembling the underlying JobGraph of the job. Connects the outputs of the given input stream to the specified output stream given by the outputID.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input data stream
        outputID - ID of the output
        typeNumber - Number of the type (used at co-functions)

      • addSink

        public DataStreamSink<OUT> addSink(SinkFunction<OUT> sinkFunction)
        Adds the given sink to this DataStream. Only streams with sinks added will be executed once the StreamExecutionEnvironment.execute() method is called.
        Parameters:
        sinkFunction - The object containing the sink's invoke function.
        Returns:
        The closed DataStream.
